Posted By: umumwhatshisname (7/25/2011 7:39:27 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Wow, that's... really bad. Here's how much damage you can do to a creature for a mana and n damage to yourself:  
0: 1 damage  
1: 2 damage  
3: 3 damage  
6: 4 damage  
10: 5 damage  
15: 6 damage  
21: 7 damage  
  
The best use I can see for it is putting it in a deck without creatures and giving it to your opponent. But he could still get rid of the counters by targeting one of his own creatures. So you'd have to do something to prevent its activated abilities too. And then probably give it shroud to prevent your opponent from just getting rid of it. And even then, he could still sacrifice it to something.  
  
Also, now that I think about it: what's the idea behind this card? A planeswalker creates an empty torture chamber where his minions make new torture equipment all the time. Only they test the equipment on their master to make sure it works well. And then, after a single proper use, all the equipment breaks down despite all the testing, and they have to start building new machines from scratch.
posts.html:

Also, now that I think about it: what's the idea behind this card? A planeswalker creates an empty torture chamber where his minions make new torture equipment all the time. Only they test the equipment on their master to make sure it works well. And then, after a single proper use, all the equipment breaks down despite all the testing, and they have to start building new machines from scratch.

posts.post_content:
Ack. Here's my redone version:  
  
Wracking Torture 1RR  
Enchantment  
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a charge counter on Wracking Torture, than it does 1 damage to you for each charge counter on it.  
  
Sacrifice Wracking Torture: Wracking Torture deals 1 damage to target player and each creature they control equal to the number of charge counters on Wracking Torture.  
  
Still not even that good, but much better than this card... >\_>
